item.title: Beef Barbacoa
item.description:
Beef Barbacoa (Slow Cooker)

A tender, richly seasoned Mexican-style beef barbacoa made easily in a slow cooker.

ğŸ›’ Grocery List

Produce

  • 1 large onion
  • 4 garlic cloves
  • 2 limes (for juice)
  • 2 bay leaves (optional but recommended)

Pantry

  • Beef broth or water (1 cup)
  • Apple cider vinegar (2 tbsp)
  • Corn tortillas (for serving, optional)

Spices

  • Oregano
  • Salt
  • Black pepper
  • Paprika
  • Ground cumin
  • Ground cloves

Proteins

  • 1.2â€“1.5 kg chuck steak (or beef brisket)

Other

  • Chipotle in adobo (1â€“2 peppers, optional but traditional)
  • Cooking oil (any)

ğŸ”§ Utensils List

  • Slow cooker
  • Cutting board
  • Knife
  • Measuring spoons
  • Small bowl
  • Forks for shredding

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients (Serves 6)

  • 1.2â€“1.5 kg chuck steak, trimmed and cut into large chunks
  • 1 large onion, roughly chopped
  • 4 garlic cloves, minced
  • 1â€“2 chipotle peppers in adobo, chopped (optional but adds smoky heat)
  • 1 cup beef broth (or water)
  • 2 tbsp apple cider vinegar
  • Juice of 2 limes
  • 2 tsp oregano
  • 2 tsp cumin
  • 1 tsp paprika
  • Â½ tsp ground cloves
  • 1Â½ tsp salt (adjust to taste)
  • 1 tsp black pepper
  • 2 bay leaves (optional)

ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ³ Meal Prep Steps

  1. Chop the onion and mince the garlic.
  2. Cut the chuck steak into large fist-sized pieces for even cooking.
  3. Mix the dry spices in a small bowl: oregano, cumin, paprika, cloves, salt, and pepper.
  4. If using chipotle peppers, chop them ahead of time.
  5. Juice the limes and set aside.

ğŸ”¥ Cooking Instructions (Slow Cooker)

  1. Sear the beef (optional but adds flavor):
    Heat a little oil in a pan and brown each side of the beef chunks. Transfer to the slow cooker.

item.title: Ground beef with potatoes, Mexican style
item.description:
ğŸŒ¶ï¸ Ground Beef with Potatoes & Mexican Chiles

A spicy, saucy, high-protein meal prep for 3 days.

ğŸ›’ Ingredients (for 4 servings â€“ scaled for 3-day meal prep below)

  • 500 g ground beef (10â€“15% fat)
  • 2 medium potatoes, diced
  • 3 medium tomatoes, chopped
  • 1 medium onion, diced
  • 2 garlic cloves
  • 1 ancho chile
  • 1 guajillo chile
  • 1 chipotle in adobo + 1 tsp adobo sauce
  • 1 tsp cumin
  • 1 tsp oregano
  • Â½ tsp smoked paprika
  • 1 bay leaf
  • Salt & pepper
  • 1 tbsp oil

ğŸ”¥ FULL RECIPE (4 servings)

1. Chile Sauce

  1. Remove stems/seeds from ancho & guajillo.
  2. Toast 10â€“15 sec each side.
  3. Soak in hot water 10 min.
  4. Blend with:
    • garlic
    • chipotle + adobo
    • cumin, oregano, paprika
    • 1 cup water/stock
    • pinch salt
    • optional 1 tsp vinegar/lime
  5. Strain if you want it smoother.

2. Cook the Dish

  1. Brown beef in oil.
  2. Add onion â†’ cook 3â€“4 min.
  3. Add garlic â†’ 30 sec.
  4. Add potatoes â†’ cook 5 min.
  5. Add tomatoes â†’ soften 3â€“5 min.
  6. Add chile sauce + bay leaf.
  7. Simmer 20â€“25 min until potatoes are tender.
  8. Adjust salt, acidity, or thickness.

ğŸ± MEAL PREP FOR 3 DAYS

3 meals = 3 servings

item.title: Mexican dhal
item.description:
ğŸŒ¶ï¸ Spicy Potato Dhal with Guajillo, Ancho & Chipotle

One-Pot â€¢ Mexicanâ€“Indian Fusion â€¢ Serves 2â€“3

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

Lentils & Potatoes

  • 1 cup red lentils, rinsed
  • 2 medium potatoes, peeled & diced
  • 1 medium onion, chopped
  • 3 cloves garlic, minced (or add to puree)
  • 1â€“2 tsp ginger, grated
  • 1 tomato, chopped (or add to puree)
  • 1 tsp turmeric
  • 1.5 tsp ground cumin
  • 1.5 tsp ground coriander
  • 1â€“2 tsp chilli powder
  • Â½ tsp crushed chilli flakes
  • Â½ tsp black pepper
  • 1 tsp garam masala
  • 1â€“2 tbsp oil
  • 3â€“3.5 cups water
  • 1 tsp salt, adjust to taste

Mexican Chilli Puree

  • 1 guajillo chilli, destemmed & deseeded
  • Â½â€“1 ancho chilli, destemmed & deseeded
  • Â½â€“1 chipotle chilli in adobo, chopped
  • Hot water (for soaking)

ğŸ”¥ Instructions

1. Prepare the Mexican chilli puree

  1. Heat a dry pan over medium heat.
  2. Toast the guajillo and ancho pieces for 10â€“15 seconds per side until fragrant.
  3. Transfer them to a bowl and cover with hot water.
  4. Soak for 10 minutes until soft.
  5. Add the softened chillies to a blender with:
    • 2â€“3 tbsp soaking liquid
    • The chipotle
    • (Optional) garlic and tomato for a smoother base
  6. Blend until very smooth.
  7. Set aside.

2. SautÃ© the aromatics

  1. Heat 1â€“2 tbsp oil in a pot over medium heat.
  2. Add chopped onion and cook for 5 minutes.
  3. Add ginger and cook 30 seconds.
  4. If not blended into the puree, add garlic and tomato and cook a minute more.

3. Fry the Mexican chilli puree

  1. Pour the chilli puree into the pot.
  2. Cook for 2â€“3 minutes, stirring, until it darkens and thickens slightly.

4. Add the Indian spices

Add and cook for 30â€“45 seconds:
